reference.shortdesc: The dita element is the root element for the ditabase document type.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The dita element cannot be specialized. It is provided as a container that can manage any sequence of any type of topic. Topic nesting rules can be configured in the document-type shell.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Do we want to mention common use case for the ditabase document-type? For example, serving as a file that contains reusable content for portion of a library or being the (temporary) output for a migration operation. Can folks think of other ways that ditabase is used?

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: xmlns:ditaarch, DITAArchVersion, and .

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows a ditabase document that contains multiple topics:
example.codeblock: <dita> <concept id="batintro"> <title>Intro to bats</title> <conbody> <!-- ... --> </conbody> </concept> <task id="batfeeding"> <title>Feeding a bat</title> <taskbody> <!-- ... --> </taskbody> </task> <reference id="batparts"> <title>Parts of bats</title> <refbody> <!-- ... --> </refbody> </reference> <!-- ... --> </dita>
